content.introduction:
This check flags all usages of 
static_cast
, where a base class is casted to
a derived class. In those cases, a fix-it is provided to convert the cast to a

dynamic_cast
.

Use of these casts can violate type safety and cause the program to access a
variable that is actually of type 
X
 to be accessed as if it were of an
unrelated type 
Z
.

This rule is part of the 
Type safety (Type.2)

profile from the C++ Core Guidelines.
